Description: Painted limestone shabti of Pairy with a black lappet-wig, a red face(much lost), a collar and crossed red hands holding two low relief hoes; the leg section is inscribed with six rows of Hieroglyphs; red seed-basket at the back of either shoulder.
Curator's comments: Aryton, Currelly & Weigall, Abydos III, 54, pl.L, 6 Reeves, The Complete Tutankhamun, 28 (number erroneously given as '38721').
Condition: fair - face lost, some damage to the surface
